title: Riot's "Stats" Seems off OR....
body:

Im Silver 3 and yet show MUCH better states then Challengers (the Pentagon shows my stats area is almost twice that of Challengers)
When i compare my stats vs VanillaHomocide (the #2 PRO Im still shown as better, the #1 Yeehaw KKona is a very odd shaped Pentagon so does not compare well)

But if that is the case I should be climbing and yet Im not.  I get to S1 (3-4 times now) and get a chain of troll/afk/feeders and I drop down some times to S4.   Every time I get up into S2-S1 its a win streak of 8-15 games and then a massive losing streak.

To me THIS tells me the MMR system is stacking the Deck.

replies.body:
Your stats are stats based off you playing against other silvers.


Those challenger stats are stats based off them going against other challengers.


Don't sit there and actually believe it was the same level playing field. Use your common sense.

...  I understand that.  Still does not explain that my stats are better (even in my Rank) and cant climb other then in my Rank skill does not matter, its luck.

So you are saying the stats are basically worthless and misleading information.

> [{quoted}](name=XXXMurderPenguin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8njnLEgj,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-09-07T07:28:46.250+0000)
>
> ...  I understand that.  Still does not explain that my stats are better (even in my Rank) and cant climb other then in my Rank skill does not matter, its luck.
> 
> So you are saying the stats are basically worthless and misleading information.

Yes. because you aren't a challenger going against challengers.

It is a stat compiled from you up against other silver players, and not anyone else.

The stat is immeasurable and incomparable against other divisions on this very simple basis, and the only reason why the stat is able to be compared against other divisions is because either someone in Riot's design team has no idea how the stats work or because it's there intentionally to let some players to go jerk off at the false prospect that they may be equal to or better than a Challenger player.

.......

It's like you're an adult doing a primary school math test and scores full mark, while the average mark a university student get for their university math test is typically around Pass (50-64 out of 100, US system may be different) because the nature of the exam is far harder and are also designed in a way that most people in the course would only score Pass. This doesn't mean you are doing better than a university student because you score a full mark, as you and the university students did A COMPLETELY DIFFERENT TEST; it just means you're doing a primary school test and scored full mark in that test.

Get it?
